meanings.definition: A group of travelers journeying together, often with a train of pack animals or vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The caravans crossed the desert together, sharing stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent2: We saw a line of caravans moving slowly across the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The caravans decided to have a race to see who could reach the oasis first.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the caravans of shoppers flooded the streets.
meanings.sent5: The image of the caravans trekking through the mountains stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: A covered vehicle for conveying passengers or goods.
meanings.sent1: The caravans were loaded with supplies for the long journey ahead.
meanings.sent2: The colorful caravans lined up at the market to unload their goods.
meanings.sent3: The caravans were so packed with people that they almost burst at the seams.
meanings.sent4: The caravans of trucks rolled into the warehouse, ready for distribution.
meanings.sent5: The shiny caravans gleamed under the sun, attracting curious onlookers.
